11.content:
"Hello Damon!" The Pokemon said telepathically. "Would you like to play with me?"

Damon fell over in surprise. "A Mew! But that's impossible!"

Mew laughed. "No I'm not. You're just being silly. I'm right in front of you. Now, do you want to play with me?"

Damon was still so surprised to see a Pokemon he was sure didn't exist asking to play with him, it took him a while to answer. But once he regained his senses, he realized that he should take this opportunity. People looked all their lives to find Mew, and if it just showed up and asked to be friends, who was he to reject the offer?

"Sure Mew, I'll play with you."

"Hooray!" Mew cheered. "But first we need to make it a fair game." Damon felt himself lifted off the ground.

"Mew, what are you doing?" Damon asked, worried.

"I'm just trying to make the game fair for you. So I'll turn you into..."
11.title: Playmate?

111.content:
Short, light blue fur began to grow all over the panicked Damon's body. "Mew, It's nice of you to want things to be fair, but I don't want to be a Mew too!"

"Really?" Mew said, seeming surprised. "Your heart seems to say you want this really badly."

Damon's nose and mouth adjusted slightly, looking more like Mew by the minute. "It does?"

"I couldn't change you into one if you didn't have both a pure heart and a desire to see everybody's true potential."

Damon started to recognize Mew's psychic "voice" as being female, but he wasn't sure how. He realized he was starting to shrink significantly as well. "Yeah, but still," he said, "I have a lot too worry about! My friends, family, and my Pokemon partners!" By this point, he had reached one foot in height and grown a tail about as long as he was.

Mew just giggled. "Give up on...? Don't be silly Damon!"

His hands and feet shank to stubby paws, and finally his eyes and ears grew to a cute size. "What do you mean?" He asked.

"I'll show you!" Mew said. She started concentrating, and suddenly, all of her thoughts and memories flooded into Damon's head. The sights, the sounds, and the knowledge of how to use every Pokemon form and move, and thousands of years of experience, all would have overwhelmed Damon as a human, but as a Mew, handling all this seemed natural. Plus, he found that he could take human form as well.

"Wow..." Damon said in awe of it all. He rushed up and hugged Mew. "THANKYOUTHANKYOUTHANKYOU!" he mentally shouted with glee. "This is amazing! I can't wait to show all my Pokemon and family this!"

Mew laughed, grabbed his paws and spun around with him. "You're welcome, but can we play first?"

"Sure!" Damon said. "What game do you want to play?"
111.title: A Mew is You!

12.content:
Damon moved carefully through the tall grass, trying to avoid being seen by the mythical Pokemon. In his time as a Rocket Elite, he had captured many rare Pokemon, but the Legendary Pokemon had proved quite difficult to trap, and always got away from him and his squad.

"But this time," he thought, clutching a stolen Master Ball, "things will finally go my way."

Damon was just about to throw the Master Ball, when Entei suddenly turned toward him and let out a mighty roar, blowing Damon off his feet! Damon dropped the Master Ball, which Entei instantly melted with a flamethrower attack. The mythical Pokemon then stomped on Damon's stomach, knocking the wind out of him and pinning him to the ground.

"So," Entei said in a deep voice, "You are the one who has been trying to capture the Legendary Pokemon. Normally, we would only let ourselves be caught to reward trainers with strong wills and pure hearts. But you, Damon, care only for power."

"M-mercy..." Damon wheezed.

"You deserve NONE!" Entei shouted, lifting up its paw to stomp Damon again. Damon braced for the worst. "But I will show you mercy anyway."

Damon gazed in shock as Entei stepped back from Damon. "However," Entei continued, "I will not let you simply walk free. You will be changed to the form of one of the world's weakest Pokemon as punishment for your arrogance and obsession with power."

Damon felt himself starting to change as Entei continued. "However, if you are found by a trainer, and together, discover the source of true strength, and use that to win the Pokemon League Championship, you may return to human form, if you wish."

Now then, what was Damon becoming?
12.title: The Rage of a Volcano.

121.content:
"You shall become in body the worm you have always been in spirit."

Damon feels himself becoming smaller and smaller. He panic's as Damon watch his fingers and toes shrink to the point of uselessness, his arms and legs following, becoming little more than stubs. His clothes don't even fit him anymore. Damon crawl awkwardly out of his shirt.

Damon's skin takes a green color, and a pale yellow on his underside, and becomes a slightly harder exoskeleton, but is still fairly soft and vulnerable. It also grows a long tail, though only in comparison to the rest of his tiny body.

His head becomes round and large in proportion to his body. Damon's mouth takes an odd shape, and his eyes turn big and black. A red antenna grows out of his forehead.

Damon looks over his nearly helpless form. He would scream, but he can't even manage that in this state.

Suddenly, Entei picks Damon up in his mouth and runs with him Damon try to get out, but all he can do is wiggle. He darts across the water, winding up in a forest before spitting him onto the ground.

Damon lay there, naked and helpless. Who will stumble upon him?
121.title: Little worm!

13.content:
Damon thought he saw a large yellow creature dash in front of him, but if one did, it ran too fast for him to get a good look. Sighing, Damon started looking for whoever sent him the letter.

But it seemed like he hadn't taken two steps before a rainstorm started up. Thinking fast, Damon got his small tent out of his backpack and hurriedly tried to set it up. Suddenly, he heard a roar that sounded like thunder, and saw a flash in the sky.

Damon panicked. He knew that trees wouldn't protect him from lightning strikes, but he also knew standing in the middle of a field setting up metal poles was also a very bad idea. "Where's a cave when you need one?" Damon muttered to himself.

He heard the roar again. Looking in it's direction, he saw, standing on a cliff, a tiger-like Pokemon, it's back covered by a cloud, it's tail made of a wave of electricity. Damon was so awed by the sight that he didn't think to get himself to safety. Then lightning struck, and he blacked out...

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Damon woke up in a deep pain. He tried to get up, but doing so just hurt too much. He looked around, and saw that he had apparently been moved by somebody into a cave. Figuring that some person probably carried him into the cave, wanting to help him, Damon called out. "Is anyone there?"

"Ah, you're awake!" A loud voice responded. "Don't move lad. I've got a Xatu flying over here right now. He can easily heal you, then you may attend to whatever you came out here for."

Damon sighed. "So, why are you helping me? Who are you?"

Suddenly, the tiger Pokemon he had seen earlier walked in front of him. "I am Raikou. And I am helping you because I inadvertently caused your injuries. Think of it as an apology."

Damon froze in terror, but after a moment realized that the tiger Pokemon was the one speaking to him. "You can talk?"

"So can you." Raikou muttered, as a Xatu flew in. Raikou pointed the bird in Damon's direction. The bird flew over Damon, chanting, and Damon's pain suddenly stopped.

"What is your name, human?" Raikou asked.

"Damon."

"Well, Damon, I would like to offer you another gift for the trouble I've caused you." Damon listened. "Your survival of the lightning strike showed me something. Thrust out your hand."

Damon gave Raikou an odd look but did as he was told. As he did, a bolt of light flew out! "Woah! How'd that happen?" Damon gaped.

"As I guessed," Raikou said, "You've gained electrical abilities. But you may not be able to fully control them. Damon, if I were to give you the ability to become an Electric Pokemon, you could control this much better. Are you interested? You would be able to switch between human and Pokemon forms at will."

Damon gazed at Raikou. "Are you serious? Is this real? I've always wanted to see what it was like to be a Pokemon!"

"I'll take that as a 'yes.' Now then, which Pokemon do you wish to become?"
13.title: Thunder Power.

14.content:
A gentle wind blew from the north. Damon turned around and saw Suicune, the mythical water Pokemon, standing tall in front of him.

"Welcome Damon, to the island where legends are born." The Pokemon said, it's voice having a feminine ring to it. "I'm glad to see you received my letter."

"You, sent me that letter?" Damon asked, confused. "What would you want with me?"

Suicune seemed to smile. "Have you studied the prophecies?" Damon gave Suicune a blank look. suicune explained. "A long time ago, humans and Pokemon live as one, nearly indistinguishable from each other. In fact they changed from one to the other quite often. But over time, the two separated."

"There are humans and Pokemon who wish for a return to the days of unity. This is why I called you. You seem to be kind-hearted and capable trainer. I will turn you into a water Pokemon, and, if under my teaching, you can learn to live as one in a month, I will know the days of unity will be returning, and teach you how to change back, as well as how to change others."

Damon was still having trouble processing or believing all this, but found the strength to ask: "And if I don't learn?"

Suicune sighed "The I will change you back, and have psychic type wipe your memory of the incident, and let you go back to your trainer's journey."

"Do I get a choice in any of this?" Damon asked, starting to worry about what might happen.

Suicune gave a remorseful sigh. "No, you must help me, or I will force you too..." And with that she opened her mouth and fired a rainbow-colored beam of light a Damon, changing him into a(n)...
14.title: The graceful water types.

15.content: Should it be Dialga or Palkia?.
15.title: The two legendary pokemon Dialga or Palkia

choices: An Early Taste of Power, a Younger, Less Powerful Dialga.
151.content:
Damon was quite shocked to see a seventeen foot tall Dragon Pokemon materialize in front of him, (Who wouldn't be?) and was paralyzed with fear and and awe. When the Dragon spoke, Damon's fear and awe grew.

"Damon Wright," The dragon addressed, "Welcome to the home of the Legendary Pokemon. I am the one who has summoned you here. I am Dialga." When the creature said its name, Damon fell face down before it.

"D-Dialga, I'm just a kid, I c-can't ask m-much except that you make m-me your servant." Damon had heard enough stories about Dialga and other legendary Pokemon before becoming a trainer to know that if one had had appeared in front of him, he had done something very good or VERY BAD. Damon figured begging for mercy was the best option if the latter was the case.

Dialga cocked a metal eyebrow. "Well, that certainly saves us time. If you wish, You may be my servant."

Damon, realizing the Legendary Pokemon had no intention of killing him, lit up. "Oh, thank you Dialga! It's an honor to serve you." Damon said, full of surprising sincerity.

Dialga gave a hearty laugh. "Well, Damon, it is pleasant to know that not all humans think of us as tyrants. But, my servant, I must tell you what I originally brought your to hear." Damon listened intently. "Damon, are you familiar with the group known as 'Team Rocket?'"

"I've heard about them, they were stealing a lot of Pokemon from Kanto and Johto."

"Yes. But few knew their leader was trying to capture the Legendary Pokemon. He had come dangerously close to trapping Ho-oh. Though Ho-oh escaped, he realized how close he had come to his doom. Thus, he decided that he would find a trustworthy human or Pokemon to be his heir, should something happen to him, and recommended that every Legendary Pokemon do the same.
"This is why I have summoned you. Should you accept this, I will give you a fraction of my power, through which I can telepathically contact you. It will also allow you to take the form of a Dragon- or Steel-Type Pokemon, and put its power to use regardless of what form you are in."

Damon Could hardly believe what he was hearing. Not only was Dialga not going to hurt him, he was offering him unparalleled power!

Dialga seemed to sense this, and added, "Do not take this power I offer you lightly. The duty of the heir to a Legendary Pokemon is immense, and, if you choose to accept it, should come before any personal goal. You must aid any Legendary Pokemon in need, including myself, if it should come to that, regardless of anything you were trying to do beforehand. And if you use your powers for evil, if you are lucky, I will come to you and take them back. If you are unlucky..." Dialga paused, and looked around nervously before quietly finishing, "Giratina will find you."

Damon had never heard of Giratina, but if its name struck fear into the hearts of even Legendary Pokemon, then Damon figured he was probably better off avoiding it.

Dialga continued. "Perhaps the most painful part to ask though, is that, if I should die, or am about to be put under the control of an evil human, I will transfer all my power to you, turning you into a new Dialga. If that happens, you must abandon everything. Your ambition to win the Pokemon League, your family, your friends, even the Pokemon you train must be given up so that you may keep the flow of time in this dimension steady. For if time doesn't flow, then all the things you hold so dear will die. This is the greatest burden of being my heir. If you do not want this, I will understand. Are you willing to accept?"

Damon was still amazed that he was even being offered this. "Dialga, may have some time to think about this?'

"Yes. You may take as long as you like. But do not leave the island before giving me an answer." Damon wandered from Dialga. This was a once in a lifetime opportunity, but if Dialga died, then he would have to give up everything that mattered to him in order to keep them all alive.

After watching the sunset, Damon made his decision. He came back to the place Dialga had first appeared, and found the legendary dragon patiently waiting for him there. "Alright Dialga, I've made my decision. I will be your heir."

"Good." Dialga said. "Now what Pokemon would you like to be?"
151.title: Dialga.

You can also change to your human form and back again whenever you want to, though since the first change is always the hardest, I think you should wait a day or two before changing back to a human again."

1531.content:
"Legendary Island." Damon mumbled looking around at the forested isle. "I wonder what's so legendary about it. And who'd send me here?"

Damon sighed. Things hadn't been the same for him since his little brother, Zach, had died one year ago. He and Zach had been quite close, traveling and battling by each-others side, enjoying the beauty of the nature.

Now, there was no more thrill in battle, no more beauty in nature, and no more reason for Damon to keep going beyond simple biological impulses telling him to stay alive. Damon constantly felt tired and lonely.

As he ambled around the island, Damon saw an ornate tower in the center of the Island. Figuring that the person who sent him the letter might be waiting there, Damon headed toward it.

After an hour's walk, Damon reached the tower. Opening the door, he found an old friend of his, Curt, speaking with several dancers in Kimonos. Curt turned around when he heard the door open.

“Damon!” The young boy ran up and hugged his friend. “I’m glad you could make it! You’re going to witness something almost nobody has ever seen!”

“Oh really?” Damon asked, putting on a smile so that Curt wouldn’t feel bad. “This seems like an out of the way place to watch a dance.”

Curt laughed a little. “I think once you see it you’ll see it’s more than just a dance.” Suddenly, the boy’s face became much more serious. “In fact, I think it may bring you much more joy than you can imagine.”

Damon gave Curt an odd look. “Wait, what?”

“Curt, it is time. We must head to the top of the tower.” One of the kimono girls said, before climbing the steps to the next floor.

“I’ll explain later!” Curt shouted as he started up the same steps.

Damon dashed to follow them, but it was a long way up, and he started to get tired two thirds of the way. Then, he faintly heard a strange melody coming from above. Something about the song filled him with hope, and with a new energy. He darted up to the top, where he saw Curt standing in front of an altar, as the kimono girls danced around him in the night air, and music seemed to be carried on the wind. It was a strangely beautiful sight to behold, but it was nothing compared to what Damon saw next.

Curt held up a feather, glowing in every color of the rainbow, and a light burst forth in the night. It flew toward the tower, where it could be clearly seen. A large, magnificent bird, twelve feet high, feathers in every color of the rainbow, landed on the altar in front of Curt, and let out a shriek.

Curt took off his hat and held it to his chest in a display of respect. Then the child spoke quietly, “Ho-Oh, You say you want that you’ve been watching me, and you respect me as a trainer. That was why the kimono girls here sent me here to you, right?”

The bird nodded.

“And you’re granting me a request, right?”

The bird nodded.

Curt’s eyes gleamed. He suddenly spoke with much more confidence. “Then Ho-Oh, I ask that you bring Damon’s brother back to life!” Damon, the dancers, and even Ho-Oh seemed to take a few steps back in shock. Ho-Oh shook it’s feathers and made several noises.

One of the kimono girls approached Curt. “Ho-Oh, says that it is amazed by your generosity Curt.”

“Really?” Curt asked. “Does that mean it’ll help?”

Ho-Oh shook its head. “Sadly, even for Ho-Oh, the power to revive the dead is not easily invoked.” The kimono girl said. “But there is one way.”

“What is it?” Curt asked.

“You and Damon must find the Sacred Ash if you want to revive his brother.” The kimono girl said. “However, the Sacred Ash is currently…”

153222221.content:
Damon searched the island for hours looking for whoever sent him this letter. He pulled out the envelope and looked over the letter again for any clue as to the sender's location. It seemed silly to give him an expensive ticket to Legendary Island for nothing but a prank, but it was looking more and more like it was the case.

Then Damon noticed something else in the envelope; a silver feather.

"How could I have missed this?" He asked as he pulled it out. Something about it seemed to comfort him, and bring back pleasant feelings from memories he couldn't quite recall. As he looked it over, he saw that no matter what angle he held the feather, the sunlight would always reflect off of it in a certain direction.

"Odd." Damon mumbled. Then a thought came to him. "Wait, maybe this light is like a compass. If I follow it, I'll find whoever sent this to me. If nothing else, it's better than running in circles like I've been doing all this morning."

Chasing the light, Damon eventually reached a cave and entered it. Unsurprisingly it was quite dark inside. Before Damon was about to turn around to leave and get a light, the feather started to glow, lighting up a path in the cave.

"Woah!" Damon gaped. He saw a drawing on the cave wall, of the Mythical Pokemon Lugia, cradling a human in its wings. Not sure what it meant, Damon continued deeper into the cave. After wandering through the winding passages for some time, he found himself in a cavern with a large underground lake. And in the center stood the gigantic Pokemon of legend, Lugia.

Most people would've been terrified by the sheer sight of it, but upon seeing it, Damon found himself only able to think of one word as hidden memories surged into his mind.

"DAD!" Damon shouted, diving into the water and swimming as fast as he could toward Lugia.

The beast of the sea picked Damon up in his wings. "I'm sorry to have to have left you Damon, and hid your memories and form from you for so long."

"Don't worry dad!" Damon assured him. "I'm just happy to be back at last."

"Indeed, the danger is over now. So let's get you back into your real body."

Lugia put Damon back into the water, as the young boy started to change back into a...
153222221.title: Son of the sea.

Silver feathers covered him completely, save for his chest, which had blue feathers instead, and his feet became large and three toed, his clothes disappearing. A long tail with two blue spikes grew from the end of his spine as his neck elongated.

Lastly, his head changed, his mouth becoming a beak, a large crest growing on the back of his head, and a blue "mask." Appearing around his eyes. Damon noticed he wasn't nearly as big as his father, and felt a little disappointed .

"Don't worry my son." Lugia said, reading his thoughts, "Ten human years doesn't even equal one Lugian year! You'll grow to my size in time. I'm just sorry that I had to send you away for that much of your childhood. But it was that or let you get captured by those wicked Rockets."

"It's fine dad." Damon said, curling up to his father.

153222222211.content:
Damon felt something warm by his side when he woke up. While it hadn't happened often, it wasn't unheard of for desperate wild Pokemon to sleep next to humans during the night, in effort to stay warm. Damon cautiously turned to look at the Pokemon. It was fairly large, and covered in red and white feathers, with a little blue triangle on its chest.

Damon felt very nervous about being so close to such a big Pokemon, and tried to scoot out of his sleeping bag without waking the Pokemon up. His efforts were for naught though, as the Pokemon's large, amber eyes fluttered open. The creature suddenly jumped Damon, hugging him in its claws.

"Good morning Damon!" The young boy heard a voice say.

"Wh-who's there? Is this your Pokemon?" Damon asked.

The Pokemon suddenly pointed to itself. "I'm talking to you. I'm a telepathic Pokemon. My name is Latias! I've wanted to meet you for so long, Damon." Latias kissed Damon on the lips, to his disgust. "Huh... I though you humans liked getting kisses from the opposite sex."

"From other humans, not Pokemon." Damon wiped his mouth. "And besides, why would a Pokemon want to talk to me?"

"You saved me from a trainer." Latias smiled.

Looking Latias over again, Damon saw that she did look like a Pokemon he vaguely remembered seeing before...

******

Leroy was having a fine day as the new Pokemon League Champion. He never realized how many fine privileges Champs were allowed.

Among these privileges was a radar that tracked the movements of a number of rare Pokemon across Kanto and Johto. Currently, it was set to find a psychic dragon called Latias. And according to the radar, it was in the tall grass, just a few feet away.

He stepped into the foliage. Sure enough, he could see the mythical Latias. It hadn't seen him yet, so Leroy decided to seize the moment and reached fore his Master Ball. But before he could throw it...

RIIIING!

Leroy's Pokegear went off, alerting Latias to Leroy's presence. It quickly flew off as the one who caused the Pokegear to ring spoke through it. "Hey Leroy, this is Damon. Me and my Zubat almost caught a Rattata, but it got away at the last second. Anyway, I'll talk to you later."

Leroy quickly grabbed his Pokegear and snapped a picture of the fleeing Latias. He then rang in Damon's number. "Hey Damon...." Leroy said through gritted teeth. "Yes yes, I know about the oh so 'tragic' loss of your Rattata, but look what your poor timing lost me!" Leroy hit a few buttons on his Pokegear, sending the photo of Latias to Damon.

******

"What an embarrassing day that was..." Damon mumbled.

"As a thank you for that, I'd like to reward you, if you want."

Damon's eyes widened. "Really?" He asked, imagining all the amazing things he might receive. "What kind of reward?"

"I'd like to turn you into a nice, strong, handsome Latios..."

What is Damon's response to this proposition?

Are you alright?" Damon yelled. Blind from the light, Damon took a step toward where he thought the Pokemon was.

"I'm alright, Human." The Keldeo yelled back. "But you must leave, something is wrong with that pendent!" For some odd reason, he felt scared for the boy. He didn't want any harm to come of Damon.

Damon followed the sound of the Keldeo's voice. He took one more step, but found a loose rock. Damon tripped and, literately, fell into the Keldeo. Their molecules shifted and merged, joining the two together. For a brief moment, Damon and the Keldeo were simply a blob of confused molecules, not knowing wether to be human or pokemon. However, this Keldeo was unique and not like any other in existence. And just as abruptly as the light had started, it ended, leaving the transformation complete.

A few minutes later, Damon blinked his eyes open. "Keldeo... Keldeo, are you alright?" Damon asked, his voice parched.

"No, I don't think We are alright." came the reply.

Damon, confused, eyed the Keldeo. "What are you..." Damon then looked down at what he thought was his body, except it wasn't his human body. It was the body of a Keldeo. "I-I'm like you... a Keldeo!" You were excited. Being a Pokemon was a dream come true.

choices: Damon and Keldeo work things out
1532222222222222222221222.content:
"Okay that's it. Keep focusing our energies together, as one." the Keldeo said confidently. "Focus that energy at the tips of our horns!" The two of them had their heads pointed slightly inwards, towards each other, and a giant blue ball of energy started to materialize infront of them. "Now fire!" Damon yelled excitedly. Together, they fired Focus Blast into the side of a small hill. Their attack completely decimated it.

"Oh Yeah!" Damon cheered. He tried to push off the ground and throw his front leg into the air. Keldeo was used to his other half's celebration tendencies and jumped with him so they wouldn't fall over. "We are totally awesome!" Damon cheered again as their feet touched the ground. "Yes We are." the Keldeo agreed. "It is amazing just how much more powerful we are now."

They had been practicing for about an hour, working on each individual attack. "Now, it is time to practice the last one we know... Sacred Sword!" the Keldeo said, unable to hide his enthusiasm. "Since all of our other attacks were now powerful, I cannot wait to see us in action for this one." the Keldeo then motioned with his head for them to turn around. By now, they had gotten better at walking and moving, but it was still a chore. Even though their attacks were incredibly powerful, a silent agreement had fallen between them. If they didn't master walking and just moving around as a team then every battle would end in their defeat.

"Sacred Sword! Yes!" Damon said as they slowly walked towards the outskirts of a small forrest. "the Keldeo then pointed with his horn at one of the very similar looking trees. "You see that one, we should charge at it and strike together with our own Sacred Swords. I'll take the first step, and then you follow." Damon nodded. "Okay, lets do it."

"Sacred Sword!" they both yelled together. One long and dazzling white sword appeared out of each of their heads, and then they were charging. They rushed forward, unsteady at first since this was the first time they ran together. They, however, quickly picked up an effective and steady system, but then the problem started. They each started to tug their body in the opposite direction, thinking of different trees to target. "What are you doing Damon. The tree is over here!" the Keldeo yelled. "No, you said it was this one over here." Damon yelled back. As the two struggled to pull their other half in their direction, they continued to run forward and ran smack into a tree. They hit the tree at full force right between their heads, which then slammed their heads against the sides of the tree. Falling backwards onto their back, neither went unconscious, but slamming into the tree had severely bruised them and knocked the wind out of them.

For several long moments, neither said a word. They only struggled, against each other, to get air back into their shared lungs. Once enough air was back in their lungs, the angry glares and shouts began. "What were you thinking!" the Keldeo exclaimed. "It was that tree." he made a half hearted attempt to point it out, but then continue to glare daggers at his other half. "What tree?! They all look the same!" Damon screamed back. "Besides, you pointed to that one." Damon copied the Keldeo's attempt at pointing out the tree he thought they were targeting.

The Keldeo growled, "Never mind about the tree. We're going to try this again." He tried to stand up, but Damon refused to move. "No, we're staying right here to rest a bit more." The arguing continued back and forth until it finally ended up into a full on brawl. Their body tossed and turned, their heads struck at each other's, and they each tried to pull apart from their other half.

choices: When they arrive to Undella Bay
153222222222222222222122222.content:
After many weeks of hard training, Damon and Keldeo had mastered their moves and worked quite well as a team now. They had developed a strong friendship and trust for one another, but they made no progress on finding the connection between themselves and the gem. Keldeo made the suggestion of leaving the island and traveling to the Unova region. The gold marking that encased the gem were from an ancient civilization in the Unova region, but Keldeo was unsure of the location specifically. So now, the two were running across the ocean, making their way to Undella Bay.

The trip over had been very quiet thus far. Both were lost in their own thoughts, the only thing they didn't share now. Even though they had a strong bond of friendship now and even enjoyed being merged, being stuck together for every minute of ever day had many difficulties. They never had a giant fight, like the one Virzion had broken up, but they still had minor problems and arguments to solve. Finally, Damon spoke, "Hey, Keldeo..." His body partner turned to look at him, "Yes Damon"

"Do you think we'll ever... become separated again? I mean, don't get me wrong. I think being a Keldeo with you is awesome, but..." Keldeo gave him a reassuring smile. "No, I know how you feel. I feel the same way about our situation. I do enjoy your company, but sharing a body like this can be... a pain... but also a lot of fun. Whatever happens we'll---"

Suddenly, a huge blast of water shot out from right underneath them. It was painful, and shot them high into the air. They landed, unsteadily back on the water. Keldeo's back leg was hurt the most. From where they were before, their attacker, a Wailord, rose to the surface.

"Ooooohhhh! What an unusually find." shouted a women from above. She seemed to be flying on hovering platform. It was technology that neither Keldeo or Damon had seen before. She had lush, wavy purple hair and was dressed all in black with an unusual shield symbol on here left arm. "A two-headed Keldeo. How strange?" Damon and Keldeo glared at the women. "And how easy it will be to capture you. Wailord, my sweet, destroy them with Brine!"

The Wailord tilted its head forward, pointing its blowhole at Damon and Keldeo. A powerful stream was water shot out which Damon and Keldeo narrowly dodged. Keldeo's hurt leg was slowing them down, but they managed to counter attack with Focus Blast. The Wailord was pushed back a small distance and now looked very angry. "Wailord use Bounce." Following the order, the Wailord quickly made a shallow dive, and surprisingly shot itself hight into the air. It made an incredible flip and was about to slam head first into the duo. However after a quick exchange, Damon and Keldeo jumped up and to the side, avoiding the attack and setting them up to finish Wailord with a powerful and synchronized Close Combat.

The lady was so awestruck that she did not have time to stop Damon and Keldeo as they bounded off in the direction of their destination. Keldeo had wanted to stay and finish off the mysterious lady, but Damon was worried about Keldeo's leg. He wanted to make sure that his other half was okay before they got into more trouble. As they dashed away, neither noticed the large underwater station surface.

choices: The start of a new adventure
15322222222222222222212222211.content:
Suddenly, the same spirt, from before, materialized before them in the light. "I am sorry for not being completely honest before; I could not speak freely until you placed me into the slot." The beautiful female spirit snapped her fingers and the large room was suddenly lit by small floating orbs. "Let me formally introduce myself. I am Juweel, the artificial spirit of the gem you wore around your necks. It was my duty to transform you into your true forms and lead you to this room where your true past memories are stored."

"Wait what?" Damon asked, very confused. He and the Keldeo glanced at each other and then back at the spirit. "What do you mean by true forms? Our true form is a two-headed Keldeo." Keldeo also asked, "And what do you mean about our 'true past memories'?"

The spirit smiled sadly. "Let me explain the whole story first." She brushed her transparent hair out from her eyes and began again. "Hundreds of years ago, all of the lands were united. All Pokemon and Humans lived in harmony in this golden age. However, an evil force came into being and threatened to destroy the world. Both of you, powerful Keldeo warriors, lead the largest army of Pokemon and Humans and managed to defeat the evil and seal it away. Unfortunately, he would not remain sealed forever."

While she was explaining, many of the orbs had joined together to form a giant video orb of sorts. Images from the past flashed by as the spirit explained. "The six lands of the world would again be in jeopardy. With their collective wisdom, the six rulers knew that by the time the evil arose again, most if not all of the world would have forgotten it. No one would be able to stop the evil, and the world would be destroyed. The six rulers asked for volunteers willing to give up the life they had in the united land, so they may fight against the evil far in the future. Only the two of you accepted. So, using their collective power, the six rulers sealed the two of you away, in two parts. Lex or Damon as you are now called, your and soul and body were stored in the Hoen land. Ius, your soul and body was stored in the Sinnoh land. Both of you memories were stored here, in the Unova land."

"Wait, that doesn't make any sense. I was born a human. If I was originally a Keldeo..." Damon argued. The spirit shook her head. "No, you were a Keldeo. But, the evil broke free sooner than was predicted. It corrupted the place where your body and soul were stored. When the time came, you reappeared into the human boy you were before. It corrupted you with false memories of being a human. I enlisted the help of Cobalion, Virzion, and Terrakion to help guide you two to meet. So that I could restore you, Lex, to your original form and then lead both of you to here."

"But that obviously did not go as planned either." Keldeo, or Ius, responded. "You didn't do a good job of returning him to his true form. Just look at us." The spirit looked a little offended, and quickly retorted, "I had little choice in the matter. The evil had me in its possession for quite some time. He drew much of my power away. I escaped, thanks to Virzion, and tried to complete my sacred charge. Unfortunately, I did not realize how much the evil took. By the time I started to transform Lex back into a Keldeo, I realized that I did not have the strength to complete it. Lex would have died mid way through. So, I did the next best thing."

"Alight, so you did the next best thing. Fine. So, now that we are here at our... memory vault... thing. Give us our past memories and finish the transformation so we can kick some evil butt." Damon said with a happy smile on his face. The spirit shook her head again. "I am sorry, Lex. I cannot finish the transformation, nor can I fully restore your memories."

"What!" Both Damon and the Keldeo exclaimed. "The vault was damaged." the spirit pointed to the large crack in the wall that neither had notice till now. "Your memories are gone, and there is not enough power for me to separate you."
15322222222222222222212222211.title: Damon and Keldeo's connection is revieled

153222222222222222222122222111.content:
Damon and Keldeo then looks at each other and decided what to do. "Well I guess we know now what we should do" said Damon. "Yeah we should find where our memories went and find a way to separate each other and then we'll just be two ordinary Keldeo's" The Keldeo replied.

"It will be a dangerous journey. Are you sure the two of you are up to it?" Juwel said to them both. "Of course now that we know what our connection is" Damon said. "Were determine to go on this journey so me and Damon could be two separate Keldeo's" The Keldeo replied.

"Then I wish you two luck then" Juwel replied as she heads back into the pendent. After talking with Juwel and learning more about their past together. Damon and the Keldeo left the ruins to start off their new journey to separate each other.

"You know Damon once we separate. We won't be a two headed Keldeo anymore" The Keldeo said. "I know and it's been so much fun being a two headed Keldeo. But I'll miss this even more" said Damon.

"We'll still be together. After all you've been a Keldeo all this time and you didn't know about it" The Keldeo said. "Yeah I always thought I was human. But it turns out I've been a legendary pokemon all this time. I just wonder what my family thinks about this" Damon said.

As the two continue to walk. They wonder what to do next. "So where do we head too next?" The Keldeo said. "Beats me. I only follow where you were going" said Damon. "Really? Because I was doing the same" The keldeo said.

"So is that mean were lost and we have nowhere to go?" Damon ask the Keldeo. "It looks like it" The Keldeo answer. "Great now what then?" Damon said. The two drop to the ground.

"Maybe I could help you two out. It looks like you might need my help" Damon and the Keldeo looks around. "Who said that? Who's there?" said Damon. "That voice. I think I know who it might be" The Keldeo said.

"Keldeo it seems you'll need more help then I thought and Damon I'm glad we can finally meet" The mysterious pokemon then appears to Damon and the Keldeo. It was one of the sword of justice pokemon. But who though?
153222222222222222222122222111.title: new adventure

choices: Cobalion leads the Keldeos to the Unknown
1532222222222222222221222221111.content:
The leader of the swords of justice stepped into view of the joined Keldeos. "Cobalion!" Both Damon and the Keldeo were excited to see him. Both quickly stood and bowed their heads as a sign of respect.

Cobalion came to a stop in front of them, examining the two of them over. He was astonished at their appearance, not knowing what had happened to them. "Please forgive me if I was gawking. Virizion told me that the two of you were bound together, but I wasn't expecting this. At least the two of you are getting along in your current predicament."

"Its not as awful as I'm sure it looks. We did have some trouble with being attached, but we have adjusted and grown to... actually like it. Despite the obvious disadvantages, our joined state comes with a lot of advantages." Keldeo explained.

Damon nodded in agreement. "We are an excellent team now."

Cobalion smiled. "Well that is good to hear. But hopefully you will not have to remain joined for much longer, for I have found a way that could lead to your separation."

"Really? So quickly." Damon and Keldeo said. They had a mixture of excitement, but also disappointment in their voices. Cobalion didn't seem to notice though.

"Yes! The Unknown have agreed to help. I am escorting you to the Solaceon Ruins in the Sinnoh region." Cobalion said. "But, we need to hurry. The unknown will only have the power to do so on the New Moon, and that is only a few days away."
1532222222222222222221222221111.title: Cobalion.

choices: Damon thinks about his human family and how they might miss him.
15322222222222222222212222211111.content:
Cobalion then leads the combine Keldeo's to the Solaceon Ruins and to the unown as well. Damon and Keldeo were wondering what they should do after they separate. "So it looks like you and me will be separated" said Damon. "Yeah were no longer be a two headed Keldeo" Keldeo said to Damon.

Damon could hear a little disappointment in Keldeo's voice. "It won't be too bad. We'll still be together even if we do get separated" said Damon. "Agree we can still do fun stuff together" said Keldeo. In a few hours they make it to the Shinoh Region and to the Solaceon ruins as well. Cobalion leads them to the end of the room.

"This should be the spot" said Cobalion. "But where are the Unown?" Damon's question was soon answer when the Unown appear. The leader of the unown, unown z, appear before Cobalion and the two Keldeo's. He takes a closer look at the combine Keldeo.

"This the pokemon you were talking about Cobalion?" Unown Z ask hm. "Yes this is the one" said Cobalion. "Can you really separate us?" Keldeo ask the Unown. "Just leave everything to us"

All the Unown gather together and fires a laser beam at the two. Damon and Keldeo felt some pain as they were raise up in the air. A flash of light came. Damon and Keldeo then felt themselves being separated and the Unown lower them down.

Damon and Keldeo open their eyes as they see they were in their own body. "We no longer share a body" said Keldeo. Damon takes a closer look and see's he was still a Keldeo.

"I'm still a Keldeo as well" said Damon. "Well of course you are. You were born as a Keldeo after all" said Keldeo. "I guess your right" said Damon. "Our work here is done. We must go now".

The Unown was then gone. "Now that's over with. We should be leaving now" said Cobalion. Damon, Keldeo and Cobalion then left the Solaceon ruins. Damon couldn't help but feel that he might be missing something from his old human life.
15322222222222222222212222211111.title: Cobalion leads the Keldeos to the Unknown

153222222222222222222122222111111.content:
Heading away from the Solaceon ruins, Damon and the Keldeo were now on their way back to the Unova Region. Cobalion, completing his mission with them needed to start his next mission of locating the evil. He directed them to Terrakion, who was currently in Black City. Terrakion had a lead on the location of where the evil force had hidden their memories.

Taking advantage of there newly separated bodies, Damon convinced Keldeo to go on ahead to Black City. Damon needed to visit Twinleaf Town, the home town of his human memories, before going to Black City. Keldeo understood. They planed to meet up in Black City within one day.

Now alone, Keldeo was crossing the ocean again. The Unova region coastline was within sight when a powerful electrical blast was fired through him. The electricity flowed through his body, paralyzing him. "HAHAHAHAHAHA! I knew you would be back this way. I will catch you now!" A familiar voice gleefully cried. A cloaked hovering platform materialized into view with the same trainer from before and a Starmie floating beside her. Keldeo just glared at her, temporarily unable to move.

The trainer then seemed to get a good look at Keldeo and was taken aback. "Wait a minute! How... did...? I know you are the same Keldeo from before. The scar on your leg is proof, but... Where is your other head?"

Keldeo, gaining control of his body again, took advantage of her shock and fired a Focus Blast at her. Starme, however, easily overpowered the Focus Blast with another Thunder attack. Keldeo cried out in pain as the paralysis took effect again.

"Guess your much weaker without your second head." the women gloated. "Too bad too. I was looking for a challenge." Keldeo tried to move, but the paralysis held his body. "Well either way, a used-to-be two-headed Keldeo is still worth studying. Maybe the scientists of Team Shade can find out what happened to you." The women pressed a few buttons on the control panel of the platform. Two orbs shot out from the underside of the platform and hovered on the right and left side of Keldeo. The orbs glowed black and shot a dark colored energy that lifted Keldeo's stunned body into the air. The women then sped off with Keldeo being dragged behind her.
153222222222222222222122222111111.title: Damon thinks about his human family

choices: Damon tries to leave. Entei stops him.
1532222222222222222221222221111111.content:
Damon makes it back to Twinleaf Town. His hometown when he was a human. "It's sure nice to be home. I wonder if mom is home. I bet she's worried about me by now" said Damon.

Making his way through town. Damon comes to his house standing at the front door. He didn't know what to say to his human mother. "What do I say? Will she even understand me? Well only one way to find out"

Damon then raise his leg and was about to knock with his hove's. But then he felt that something was wrong. "Something's not right. I just don't know it. Keldeo is in trouble. I can feel it. I'll have to see my mother later"

He then left Twinleaf Town and heads back to Unova, He begins to cross the sea and eventually makes it to Black Town where Terrakion was waiting. "At least your safe Damon" said Terrakion.

"Terrakion do you know if Keldeo made it?" Damon ask Terrakion. "Afraid not. Keldeo was capture by a female human. He was taking to Team Shade" Terrakion told Damon.

"Well we can't just stand here and do nothing we have to rescue him" said Damon. "Your not going anywhere. Team Shade will come after you as well. The legendary pokemon will take you to a safe place" said Terrakion.

"What about Keldeo?" Damon ask Terrakion. "Me, Cobalion and Virizion are going to Shade's base and go rescue him yourself. We don't want to risk of you being capture as well" said Terrakion.

Entei then appears. "I came as soon as I can" said Entei. "Entei take Damon to a safe place. I'll go help Cobalion and Virizion to save Keldeo" said Terrakion. "I'll make sure he get's to a safe place let's go Damon" said Entei.

"But" said Damon. "Just go. I'm not going to tell you again" Seeing Terrakion was serious. Damon heads off with Entei as Terrakion heads off to save Keldeo.
1532222222222222222221222221111111.title: Something's wrong.

choices: Swords of Justice in the secret base
15322222222222222222212222211111112.content:
Entei lead Damon away from Black City, toward the other end of the Unova region. Currently they were crossing through Lostlorn Forest when Damon all of a sudden collapsed. Pain. Sharp Pain was all he felt on the right half of his body. That side spasmed painfully and uncontrollably. But just as suddenly as the pain started, it stopped. Breathing hard, Damon slowly picked himself up.

"Are you alright?" Entei asked, worry written on his face.

"No!" Damon spat. "Something is wrong with Keldeo! I don't know what, but something is wrong! They might be experimenting on him or something. And... I... I need to do something." Damon quickly turned to leave, but Entei jumped over him, and blocked his path.

"Where do you think your are going? If anything, this just shows that I need to take you to safety, and quickly." Entei reasoned, but Damon wasn't listening.

"Out of my way Entei! I don't want to hurt you, but I need to help Keldeo! If you stay in my way, I'll have to take you down."

"Damon, listen. We cannot let you get captured. The Swords of Justice will--" What Entei was about to say was cut off because Damon closed the short distance between himself and Entei in order to attack with Close Combat. Entei narrowly managed to dodge. "Very Well! I had wanted not to harm you, but apparently I have no choice."

"Get out of my way Entei! I have the advantage of type here. You won't be able to stop me!" Damon yelled.

"Hmph! Type is meaningless when you are severely out powered." Entei roared, and unleashed a devastating Fire Blast.

Damon couldn't dodge. Instead, he tried to block it with a powerful Hydro Pump. However when the attacks met in midair, the Fire Blast was far stronger. The heat from the fire boiled the water, and the two attacks combined for a devastating effect on Damon. He was pushed into the side of a rock, where he crumbled to the ground from his burns.

He lost consciousness momentarily. When he woke, the pain from the wounds were mostly gone. He examined his body to find his burns covered in a past like substance. "Its a blend of Iapapa, Rawst, Kuo berries." Entei said. He was lying down beside him, rubbing the mix of berries into one of Damon's other wounds. "In a few hours, your burns will be healed. Then we will head off again towards the safe zone that the other legendaries have created."

Damon just dropped his head between his front legs, but agreed to continue with Entei. He knew now that he had little chance of escaping to help out Keldeo. He would just have to trust that the Swords of Justice will be able to rescue you him.
15322222222222222222212222211111112.title: Damon tries to leave. Entei stops him.

153222222222222222222122222111111121.content:
Cobalion, Virizion and Terrakion had made it to the secret base of Team Shade. "This should be the secret base" said Cobalion. "Keldeo must be in this base. We have to go look for him" said Virizion.

The sword of justice pokemon then goes into the base to go rescue while taking out some guards that get in their way. A few minuets later. The sword of justice pokemon has come upon a lab.

"Do you think he might be in there?" said Terrakion. "We have to hope he's in there" said Cobalion. Virizion then see's a window that show's the inside of the lab. Virizion takes a look inside.

"Cobalion Terrakion take a look" Cobalion and Terrakion then takes a closer look. "What is it Virizion?" Upon closer look they see Keldeo and 3 scientist experimented on him. Keldeo was in pain.

"Our experiment is going very well" said the first scientist. "Yes this Keldeo is doing pretty good" said the second scientist. "Too bad his second head is not with him. I wonder where it go" said the third scientist.

"Doesn't matter. This Keldeo with one head will do fine" said the first scientist. "It's Keldeo" said Terrakion. "Let's not waste any time then" said Cobalion.

Without wasting anymore time. The sword of justice pokemon breaks through the door and takes out the three scientist. They then break the bonds that tie Keldeo down. Keldeo opens his eyes to see them.

"You guy's came" said Keldeo. "Were breaking you out of here Keldeo" said Cobalion. "I can't move that very well. It hurts so much" said Keldeo. "We'll help you get out of here" said Virizion. "Let's get going then" said Terrakion.
153222222222222222222122222111111121.title: Swords of Justice in the secret base

choices: The experiment done on Keldeo activates at the safezone
1532222222222222222221222221111111211.content:
With the help from the other Swords of Justice, Keldeo is lifted onto the back of Terrakion. Now the harder part of the mission, escaping from the base, began. By the time they left the room that Keldeo was imprisoned in, the alarm had been rung. Grunts of Team Shade quickly blocked their path, however the grunts and their pokemon were easily defeated by Cobalion.

At every corner, more grunts tried to stop them. But, they were all quickly defeated. "Why is this so easy? Its almost like they want us to escape..." Virizion stated as she ran along in front with Cobalion.

"Nevermind that." Cobalion yelled as he knocked down a Houndour and his trainer. "Let's just get out of here before any tougher opponents show up."

Soon after that, the Swords escaped from the base and were on their way to the safehaven where Damon and Entei were now.

The female trainer from before smiled as she watched them leave. "Perfect! Second objective complete. Now lets see if the bosses plan works."
1532222222222222222221222221111111211.title: Escaping the secert base.

15322222222222222222212222211111112111.content:
A few minuets later. Cobalion, Terrakion and Virizion had made it to the safe zone where Damon and Entei is at. "Is Keldeo okay?" Damon ask them. "Yes we got him out just in time" said Cobalion.

Terrakion then places Keldeo down who was still injured from the experements on him. Damon goes up to Keldeo. "Keldeo are you okay? What happen to you? Who did this to you?" He ask Keldeo.

Keldeo didn't respond as he was shaking. "Keldeo was being experimented on" said Virizion. "We help him out as the best as we can" said Terrakion. "But he still got hurt from it" said Cobalion.

"We need to heal him then" said Damon. "We'll go find some orran berry's and see if we can heal him" said Cobalion. Cobalion, Virizion and Terrakion then left to get some Orran Berry's.

Damon waits for the sword of justice pokemon to come back. Entei had left on orders from Ho-oh and said he'll come back later. Keldeo was knock out from his injures.

"I hope the sword of justice pokemon comes back soon" Damon didn't know the experiment, on Keldeo, has activated. Keldeo then get's up and walks up to Damon. Damon see's Keldeo.

"Keldeo your awake. How do you feel?" said Damon. "I feel fine Damon" Keldeo respond to Damon. Damon notice something was off about Keldeo due to his eyes looking weird.

"Keldeo what's wrong? You don't look okay" said Damon. "But I am fine. I have an idea. Let's merge again what do you say? I bet the two of us will become powerful together" said Keldeo.

"After Cobalion help separate us. I don't think so. Keldeo this isn't like you" said Damon. "Then if you don't want to merge with me. I'll have to force you to do it if I have to" said Keldeo.
15322222222222222222212222211111112111.title: The experiment done on Keldeo activates at the ...

choices: Crazed Keldeo gives chase and remerges with Damon
Crazed Keldeo chases Damon, but the Swords of Justice intervene
153222222222222222222122222111111121111.content:
"Keldeo, calm down." Damon started to slowly back away, trying to get some distance between him Keldeo. "Why do you want to remerge all of a sudden when we spent a good amount of time trying to get separated?" His friend's new attitude was scaring him. 'What did they do to him?' Damon asked himself.

"We were wrong to think we should be separated. Being joined was a lucky accident. Our powers were incredible, and would only grow with time." Keldeo smiled sinisterly. "Now, come on over so we can be reunited."

"This is crazy!" Damon exclaimed. "I don't want to be two-headed with you! I like having my own body."

Keldeo growled. "Fine, I will have to do this the hard way!" Suddenly Keldeo lunged.

Damon was expecting that, and easily jumped to the side. However, an unusual feeling washed over Damion. He could feel a slight tug or pull towards his friend. In fact, his fur slightly pointed towards Keldeo despite a soft breeze blowing in the opposite direction.

He didn't have much time to think about that. Keldeo jumped at him again, getting closer this time. "Keldeo stop this!" Damon jumped into the air and fired a warning Focus Blast directly in front of where his friend stood. "I will knock you down if you come at me."

"Just try!" Keldeo charged Damon. His small horn glowed with power as his Sacred Sword grew from his head.

Damon landed and summoned his own Sacred Sword. Sparks flew when the two swords met. Equally strong as Keldeo, Damon held his ground, but luck was not on his side. That familiar tug returned, but far stronger. He dug his hoves in the dirt to avoid being drawn closeror off balance.

Keldeo noticed. "You feel it, don't you? No use fighting it. Our bodies will rejoin whether you want to or not."

Damon didn't bother responding. He ended his Sacred Sword attack, a risky move, to get out of the standstill they were in. Keldeo's sword sliced his back left leg as he dashed away. The fresh wound hurt with each step he took. But at least the tugging sensation towards Keldeo weakened as the space between them grew.
153222222222222222222122222111111121111.title: Keldeo attacks Damon.

choices: Cobalion finds the two of them.
Damon and Keldeo get's back to the lab.
1532222222222222222221222221111111211111.content:
The crazed Keldeo then gives chase as Damon tries to get away. "Keldeo stop" He tried everything to calm his friend, but nothing happen. At last Keldeo caught up to him.

Damon begins to feel himself closer to Keldeo. He tries to fight it. "No I don't want to merge with you again" said Damon. "Stop fighting it Damon. It's our destiny to be together"

He tries to fight it. But it was no use. Finally Damon and Keldeo's body's were touching as a bright light cover the two pony pokemon as they begin to merge.

When the light clear. Damon and Keldeo were merge again. Damon was also being control too after fusing with his friend. "How do you feel now Damon?" Keldeo ask.

"Stronger then ever. You were right. We should have just stay merge. Were much stronger when were together" said Damon. "I am glad to hear that" said Keldeo.

"What do we do now?" Damon ask. "We should head back to our masters. They are waiting for us back at the lab" said Keldeo. Damon and Keldeo then left.

Cobalion, Terrakion and Virizion return but see's that the two Keldeo's are gone. "Damon and Keldeo are not here" said Terrakion. "Yes and I fear for the worst that something might have happen to them" said Cobalion.

"We should go look for them then and see if there okay" said Virizion. "Understood. Let's split up and look for them. They couldn't have run off to far"

The sword of Justice pokemon then heads out to find the two Keldeo's.
1532222222222222222221222221111111211111.title: Crazed Keldeo gives chase and remerges with Damon

choices: Cobalion knocks some sense into one of them
1532222222222222222221222221111111211111.content:
After the Swords of Justices split up, it was not long before Cobalion picked up on Damion and Keldeo's trails, or trail. He found signs of a struggle, where the two seemed to be fighting. Cobalion pieced together that the fight was short. One of the two broke it off and tried to escape. But that Pokemon was injured. Spots of dried blood followed the same path as the foot prints.

Cobalion bent forward to smell the blood, "Damon." he stated allowed. He turned his head back and forth to take in the entire scene. His closed his eyes and imagined what the battle looked like. "Why would Keldeo attack Damon?" Opening his eyes again, he followed the two trails of footprints, Keldeo was obviously chasing Damon.

Damon had enough strength to run for awhile, Cobalion noticed. But inevitably, Keldeo caught him. Another struggle, far shorter, and then... "Curious?" he commented. The two distinct tracks became one set. It was as if one of them just disappeared. "Was Damon defeated and drug away?... No, there isn't a sign that he collapsed, let alone any dragging signs."

"Did Keldeo have help?" He looked up at the forrest roof. "No... its too dense for a flying type swoop in and carry Damon." He looked around the spot, and determined that there was no one else there. "What happened here? Even the drops of blood from Damon's wound stop." He put his questions aside and dashed after the one set of tracks. He didn't want to loose who ever these were.

The sun was slowly setting as he followed the tracks. If he didn't find whoever these were soon, he would not be able to continue until sunrise. Luck was on his side though. The tracks were getting fresher.

Within a few more minutes he came to a clearing next to a refreshing lake. Despite the quickly diminishing light, he could see Keldeo, or Damon, drinking from the lake, he still wasn't sure whose tracks he was following.

He stayed in the shadow of the forrest line so the Keldeo wouldn't be able to see him. As he focused on the Keldeo drinking, he was surprised to see that there was actually two of them. Damon and Keldeo were drinking from the lake. The light from the rising crescent moon helped a bit. The light cleared showed to distinct heads drinking. "Why would Damon go with Keldeo, and where were his tracks."

Cobalion decided to show himself. He stepped out from his hiding spot and calmly walked to the two Keldeos. His hooves lightly crushed the leaves and grass underneath them. This drew the attention of both Keldeo and Damon. However, Cobalion did not know who was more surprised, them or him. When they turned to face him, it was suddenly clear why there was only one set of tracks. "Damon... Keldeo... What happened? Why are you...."

"Because we want to be." Keldeo and Damon spoke as one. It was unnerving. Something was very off about them both. "We are powerful as one. More powerful then you." The both grinned devilishly.

Cobalion decided to change the subject. "Damon, where are you to heading? We have all been looking for you?"

Not surprising, Damon and Keldeo spoke as one again. "We--I am heading back to see our--my masters. They are in need of us--me." Their tone was changing, becoming singular. They were becoming single minded now. "They are in need of me."

"Back.. back to where? No, back to the human base. To those monsters?" Cobalion was astonished. Something had clearly gone wrong. Whatever those evil humans did to Keldeo now effected them both.

"Don't try and stop me, Cobalion." Damon and Keldeo spit out his name in disgrace. "I will end you if you follow me!"

"I cannot let the two of you leave. You don't know what you are doing?" Cobalion tried to reason.

"No, you don't know what you are doing." The single-minded Keldeos spat before lunging at Cobalion.
1532222222222222222221222221111111211111.title: Cobalion finds the two of them.

1532222222222222222221222221111111211111.content:
Cobalion then fight's against the Keldeo's. But he wasn't very much of a challenge to them. Eventually they easily beat Cobalion as he falls to the ground and place their hove on him.

"So much of the leader of the sword of justice. You weren't even worth my time" said Damon and Keldeo. "You two won't get away with this" said Cobalion.

"Oh but I have. Goodbye Cobalion" Damon and Keldeo then runs off. Virizion and Terrakion then finds Cobalion who was hurt as they rush to his aide.

"Cobalion are you okay?" Terrakion ask. "I'll be fine" said Cobalion. "Your hurt bad. Did you find Damon and Keldeo?" Virizion ask. "Yeah but they were fuse together again. There's something wrong with them. We need to go after them" said Cobalion.

"Your not going anywhere. Not in the condition your in" said Virizion. "Virizion's right. You need to heal first before we go after them" said Terrakion.

Virizion and Terrakion then found some healing herbs and begins to heal Cobalion's injures. After healing Cobalion they head off to find Damon and Keldeo.

They eventually make it to the base where they kept Keldeo at and heads in without no one noticing. They eventually find the room where Damon and Keldeo were being tested at.

"Amazing. The two Keldeo's are much strong when fuse" said one of the scientist. "This will be great for our experiment now that the two Keldeo's are under our control" said the other scientist.

"There keeping them in there" said Virizion. "We need to get them out before they could do anymore testing" said Terrakion. "Wait we need to think first before busting in and save them" said Cobalion.

"Do you have a plan?" Virizion ask. "No but I'm trying to come up with one" said Cobalion. "Well we can't waste them standing here" said Terrakion.
1532222222222222222221222221111111211111.title: The Keldeos defeat Cobalion easily

choices: The Keldeos awake, and are not happy to be rejoined
1532222222222222222221222221111111211111.content:
"Don't move Terrakion, you might ruin any chance we have at rescuing them." Cobalion insisted. The stared at each other for a long moment, before Terrakion dropped his gaze. A sure sign that Cobalion had convinced him, at least for now, not to barge in. Cobalion then turned his focus back to the room where the joined Keldeo's were in.

Surveying the room, he counted a total of four humans. All of them wore white coats, meaning they were all researchers, not fighters. The three of them could take them out easily before an alarm was wrung, but the real issue was Keldeo and Damon. How on earth were they going to free them.

They could break the joined Keldeos out, but they would still be under control of some hidden machine. And to add further issues, both Cobalion and Virizion knew that if whatever was controlling the two Keldeos was not stopped soon, then both of them would be lost forever.

Cobalion sighed heavily. It was a no win situation. Or it was until Poké luck was on their side.

"What do you geeky-brains think you are doing?" a lady in a dark suit and wavy purple hair walked into the room. All of the scientists squirmed as they say her walk in. She obviously held much authority. "What have you been doing to my lovely prize?"

"Uh--Madam Veronica... we didn't expect to see you." a scientist nervously said. "We were just about to..."

"Save it!" Veronica glared the scientist down. "I know you Gerald. You were planning all sorts of horrible experimentation on this rare specimen. But I will not have my prize Keldeos tortured by the likes of you." The cowardly scientist dropped his gaze and looked at his feet. Veronica walked over to Damon and Keldeo. She gingerly messaged their heads. "Its okay, mommy is here to save you."

Damon and Keldeo both looked up instantly with the same lifeless stare. They were like robots. Veronica quickly turned back to the scientist, Gerald. "What have to done to my Keldeos?" She screamed.

"This-this was the only... way to-to control them. We had to implant the device into the one we had so we could..."

"Why is it still in them then. You were supposed to remove it." Veronica glared daggers at him. "I know that the device does to the minds of Pokemon. I will not have my prize be brain dead."

"B-but then the Pokemon might attack. We can't control--"

"Don't worry about controlling them. That is my area of expertise. Now remove the device, and inform me the moment it is done. I will be taking my prize back with me." Veronica then turned on her heels and headed for the door. Stopping in the door frame, she turned slightly to address the coward. "Oh and Gerald. I wouldn't try any more funny business if I were you. Many of my other prizes are quite hungry." With that, she continued on. The room remained silent for a long moment before Gerald quickly exclaimed in a very scared and higher pitched voice for his assistance to prepare the Keldeos.

The Swords stood in their hiding spot stunned at what had occurred, but pleased that at least one solution to their problem was being solved. They would just have to wait a little longer, and they would be able to rescue the Keldeos once the mind-controlling device was removed. The only thing that worried Cobalion was the woman, Veronica. She seemed especially dangerous. They would have to get the Keldeos out of there without crossing paths with her.
_______

A few hours later, the procedure to the remove the device had been completed. The joined Keldeos had been drugged so as not to wake and cause trouble. Thats when Cobalion ordered the swords to start his rescue plan. They silently took down the few scientists still in the room. Cobalion and Vizirion helped the Keldeos onto Terrakion's back, and quickly made their escape. Thankfully, they did not run into the woman Veronnica.

Finally a long distance away from the base, the Swords stopped to rest. Vizirion volunteered to watch the Keldeos while the other two search for food.
1532222222222222222221222221111111211111.title: Cobalion has a plan.

"How are you sure about that?" Keldeo ask. "Lord Arceus might help. We just need to get to the hall of Origin to talk with him" said Virizion. "Lord Arceus?" Damon ask.

"He's a very powerful pokemon and he helps us legendarys and other pokemon as well" said Virizion. After they talk a bit. Cobalion and Terrakion returns with some food.

They begin to eat for a bit and then heads off to the hall of Origin. After a few hours of getting there and resting a bit. They make it to the hall of Origin.

There they meet the legendary Arceus. "Greetings my children" said Arceus. The sword of justice bow with Damon and Keldeo bowing as well.

"So what brings you here to my home?" Arceus ask. "Lord Arceus this is Keldeo. They original use to have a single body until they were merge" said Cobalion.

"I see. I can sense one of the Keldeo's use to be a human" said Arceus. "That will be me until I learn that I use to be a Keldeo a long time ago" said Damon.

"Will you be able to separate us so we can have our own body?" Keldeo ask. "And to make sure we can never merge again?" Damon ask as well.

"I can try. But it will take a while to separate you two and to make sure you two never merge again. Come with me. We'll begin the separation in the next room".

Damon and Keldeo were then taken to another room. Arceus talks with the sword of justice before entering. "I sense evil humans coming this way. They won't be able to see my home. But it must be protected at all cost. I want you three to protect my home so I'll be able to separate the two Keldeo's" said Arceus.

"We will do our best lord Arceus" said Terrakion. "I wish you all good luck then" Arceus then heads into the other room to separate the two Keldeo's as the swords of justice went out to protect the hall of origin.
1532222222222222222221222221111111211111.title: The Keldeos awake, and are not happy to be rejo...

1532222222222222222221222221111111211111.content:
All three of the swords were surprised to see the intruder already strutting into the hall of origin. It was the same woman that they had seen in the base. She wore a skin tight, black shirt with a dark trench coat that touch her ankles. Four pokeballs were strapped to her belt, with a dangerous looking whip at her side. In her left hand was the Azure Flute.

The smirked when the swords walked into her view. "You three... are going to try and keep me from my prize." She placed her free hand to her lips, faking an attempt to hide her giggles. "You're hardly worth my time... and you're defiantly not worth my gorgeous Pokemon's time. I hate doing the dirty work, but I don't want you do bore my precious dears." While she spoke she slipped the flute into her jacket.

Terrakion took his chance. Cobalion yelled at him to stop, but it was too late. He sprinted towards Veronica, his sacred sword appeared in front of him. But long before he could reach the woman, Veronica unleashed her whip, wrapping it around his front foot. He tripped and imbedded his sacred sword into the ground before it disappeared. Veronica then slash left and right with her whip. Terrakion barely got to his feet before he collapsed, unconscious.

The whip was far more than what it seemed. Terrakion collapsed, unable to get his feet underneath him. His muscles were weak, useless. Virizion and Cobalion were stunned. Veronica stared down the remaining two Swords. "Don't worry, your brethren will be fine. I wouldn't dare kill a pokemon."

Cobalion looked towards Virizion, "How did she take down Terrakion so easily?"

Before Virizion could respond, Veronica answered. "My whip is specially made, by me. You only need to know that it is... a bane, to all Pokemon." The swords didn't know what astonished them more, the information she gave them, or the fact that she understood them. Before they could react, Veronica charged swept her whip in front of her, slicing both Virizion and Cobalion across their chests. Cobalion then dodge right, to avoid another attack. Virizion was not so lucky. A few more hits from the whip and she too fell.

Even from that one hit, Cobalion could feel himself weakening. But he could not back down now. He charged Veronica. She slashed with her whip, and he dodged it. Now within close range, he unleashed his sacred sword. He slashed wide and low, but Veronica easily jumped over the blade and struck him with her whip. Again and again she hit, until he finally fell. She smirked, "Well that was somewhat fun! Sorry for having to do that dears, but you were in my way."

Veronica continued on to the next room, where she found Arceus, Damon, and Keldeo. Bathed in a white light, she thought that she was too late. But upon closer inspection, it became clear that the two Keldeos were still joined. "Well hello my dears." She greeted them in a sing-song voice.

Arceus looked up from what he was doing, ending the light. He was honestly surprised to see the woman. "Hmmmh... I doubted your ability."

Veronica shook her head, "No great Arceus... you doubted the abilities of the Swords of Justice. But... how could you not. I am just one insignificant human after all." No one made a sound for a moment. She took the opportunity to glance around the magnificent room in Arceus's domain. "I am sure you know why I am here. I would like my Pokemon back."

"We are not yours!" Damon spat at her.

"Well, you are quite wrong there. You will come to love being with me, but we can let this argument slide for now." She turned his attention towards Arceus. "Now, I do believe you have a choice to make Lord Arceus. You can let me walk out of here with my Keldeos, or you can try and stop me. With your power, I am sure that my team and I will have our hands full fighting you." She lightly tapped the pokeballs at her side. "We would most likely loose to one as powerful as you. And, I hope you don't choose to fight because, well, I would not want to. I am a realistic woman. I would not want any harm to come to ONE of the most powerful Pokemon in existence. The world might not recover if you were hurt and could not perform your duties. So... I have devised a trade."

Veronica slid the sleeve of her coat up her arm to reveal a computer pad. She pressed a few buttons and pointed her wrist at the ground in front of her. Two small projectors flew from her wrist into the ground. As soon as they stuck, they formed a holographic image. It showed Palkia and Giratina trapped somewhere by two glowing orbs. "So..." Veronica continued. "A trade. Two of your most powerful servants for my two Keldeos."
